clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Characterize Acute and Chronic Directional Aspects of Deep Brain Stimulation
clinical_study.official_title: Directional Lead: Investigation of Rotational Current Steering, Ease of Use of Clinical Effects Map, and Therapeutic Outcomes of Deep Brain Stimulation

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to characterize the programming effects of Boston Scientific Vercise™ PC System using the DBS Directional Lead for bilateral STN DBS for the treatment of Parkinson's disease in acute and chronic settings.

primary_outcome.measure: Optimal set of stimulation parameters as measured by therapeutic window
primary_outcome.description: using predefined sets of programming parameters (combination of distribution of current per contact, amplitude, pulse width and frequency) to identify optimal (omni)directional stimulation parameters as measured by therapeutic window

secondary_outcome.measure: Optimal set of stimulation parameters as measured by therapeutic window
secondary_outcome.description: using predefined sets of programming parameters (combination of distribution of current per contact, amplitude, pulse width and frequency) to identify optimal (omni)directional stimulation parameters as measured by therapeutic window

arm_group.description: Clinician can use any type of stimulation that they deem best for the patient

intervention.intervention_name: Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) Boston Scientific VerciseTM PC System with Directional Lead

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of bilateral idiopathic PD with the presence of rigidity and at least one (1) of the following: resting tremor or bradykinesia.
- UPDRS III score of >25 in the meds OFF condition
- Medication must improve PD symptoms by ≥30%, as measured by UPDRS subset III score
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Any significant psychiatric problems, including unrelated clinically significant depression as determined by the investigator
- Any current drug or alcohol abuse as determined by the investigator
- Any history of recurrent or unprovoked seizures
- Any significant medical condition that is likely to interfere with study procedures or likely to confound evaluation of study endpoints, including any terminal illness with survival <12 months
